Description of incident: Customers who went to Alamo Drafthouse Cinemas may have had their debit and credit card information stolen due to a theft of information from N/L Entertainment.  The Bank of Charles Town is suing N/L Entertainment for failing to prevent the theft, which lead to at least 232 fraudulent purchases made using Bank of Charles Town customer debit cards.  The Bank of Charles Town is seeking $29,919.74 in damages plus an unspecified amount in interest. The breach was first noticed and reported to the public in September.  Thieves had taken financial information from people who used their debit or credit cards to make transactions between the end of June 2011 to late August of 2011.
